page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: The block comprises a largely rural area of S. Nottinghamshire to the south of the Trent Valley (the traditional dividing line between southern and northern England). It contains the small villages of{Wysall} (pop. approx. 250) and{Widmerpool} (pop. <200), each about 9 miles from the city of Nottingham and within 3 miles of the large village of Key- worth. In earlier times Wysall (Domes- day Wisoc; "A Hill of Plants") and Widmerpool (Domesday Wimarspol) had shops, tradesmen and a village school, but now neither has school, shops or post office (Wysall's P.O. closed in 1984). The railway station at Widmer- pool was outside the block, and is now closed. Only minor roads traverse the block.
